Title: The Tree of Life

Screenplay: Terrence Malick 
Starring: Brad Pitt, Sean Penn, Jessica Chastain, Fiona Shaw, Crystal Mantecon, Joanna Going, Jackson Hurst, Dalip Singh, Kimberly Whalen, Kari Matchett, Brenna Roth, Jennifer Sipes, Zach Irsik, Brayden Whisenhunt, Danielle Rene, Tamara Jolaine, Hunter McCracken 
Rating: Suitable for all audiences 


Synopsis: 
Story of three brothers during the 50's and how the greatest of them live the loss of innocence. 

We see the development of a child, Jack, 11, of the Midwest. At first everything is wonderful in his eyes, but their parents get two very different images of the world, while his mother is the ways of love and compassion, her father tries to teach him how hard life, to survive and overcome. Both will fight for your attention and Jack must combine the two teachings. Everything begins to change when first experienced the disease, suffering and death. The world, until then clean and bright, it becomes dark and frustrating. 

This story combines with the adult Jack, a lost soul in a modern world that will try to find among the scenes of his childhood that which remains unchanged, the eternal plan of which we all belong. When you discover all that has eluded him for the way you learn to value things that are to come. Jack, with a new vision of the world is well able to forgive her father for the first time to their steps through life. 

Production notes: 
- Winner of the Palme d'Or at the 64th Cannes Film Festival 2011
